column1: A sprain is an injury to the ligaments around a joint.
After examining your elbow, your doctor may order an X-ray to see if there are any fractures or breaks to the bones in your elbow.
You may also have an MRI of the elbow.
You can use ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), or naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn) to reduce pain and swelling.
Acetaminophen (Tylenol) helps with pain, but not swelling.
- Talk with your doctor before using these medicines if you have heart disease, high blood pressure, kidney disease, or have had stomach ulcers or internal bleeding in the past.
